paper_abstract: A total [k]-coloring of a graph is a mapping such that any two adjacent or incident elements in receive different colors. Let denote the sum of the color of a vertex and the colors of all incident edges of . A total -neighbor sum distinguishing-coloring of is a total -coloring of such that for each edge , . By , we denote the smallest value in such a coloring of . PilA > niak and WoA(0)niak conjectured for any simple graph with maximum degree . In this paper, we prove that this conjecture holds for any planar graph with maximum degree at least 13.
paper_title: Neighbor sum distinguishing total colorings of planar graphs
